section.heading: Michigan Avenue Viaduct — Use by street railway companies.
section.text: No street railway company shall use the viaduct or any approaches thereto authorized by § 9-320 for its tracks until the said company shall have paid to the Collector of Taxes of the District of Columbia a sum equal to one-fourth of the cost of said viaduct and approaches, which sum shall be deposited to the credit of the District of Columbia.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Office of Collector of Taxes abolished: See Historical and Statutory Notes following § 9-310.
